tools.name: LB-t

It supports general lattices (D2Q9, D3Q15, D3Q19, D3Q27) and is implemented in C++17 with OpenMP parallelization.

tools.detailed_description: Patch version of OpenFOAM-2.3, a C++ toolbox for continuum mechanics simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-4.x
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 4.x)
tools.detailed_description: Patch version of OpenFOAM-4, a C++ toolbox for continuum mechanics simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-5.x
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 5.x)
tools.detailed_description: Patch version of OpenFOAM-5, a C++ toolbox for continuum mechanics simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-6
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 6)
tools.detailed_description: Version 6 of the OpenFOAM Foundation release for CFD simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-7
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 7)
tools.detailed_description: Version 7 of the OpenFOAM Foundation release for CFD simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-8
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 8)
tools.detailed_description: Version 8 of the OpenFOAM Foundation release for CFD simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-9
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Version 9)
tools.detailed_description: Version 9 of the OpenFOAM Foundation release for CFD simulations.

tools.name: OpenFOAM-dev
tools.one_line_profile: The Open Source CFD Toolbox (Development Version)
tools.detailed_description: Development repository for OpenFOAM, containing the latest features and updates for the CFD toolbox.

tools.name: OpenIFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Immersed Finite Element Method based on deal.II
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Immersed Finite Element Method (IFEM) built upon the deal.II library, suitable for fluid-structure interaction and other multiphysics problems.

tools.name: OpenRadioss
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element solver for dynamic event analysis
tools.detailed_description: An industry-proven, open-source finite element analysis solver specifically designed for dynamic event analysis, such as crashworthiness, impact, and high-speed dynamics.

tools.name: OpenSEMBA-dgtd
tools.one_line_profile: Maxwell's curl equations solver using discontinuous Galerkin methods
tools.detailed_description: A solver for Maxwell's curl equations utilizing discontinuous Galerkin time-domain (DGTD) methods for computational electromagnetics.

tools.name: pbsv
tools.one_line_profile: PacBio structural variant calling and analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for calling and analyzing structural variants (SVs) from PacBio long-read sequencing data.

tools.name: svpack
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant analysis tools
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools for filtering, visualizing, and analyzing structural variant calls, typically used in conjunction with pbsv.

tools.name: StructuralVariantAnnotation
tools.one_line_profile: R package for structural variant analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R package that provides infrastructure for analyzing and annotating structural variants, facilitating integration with the Bioconductor ecosystem.

tools.name: Guanaco
tools.one_line_profile: Grasshopper plugin linking Rhino, Gmsh, and Calculix for FEA workflows
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Grasshopper (Rhino) that integrates Gmsh for meshing and Calculix for Finite Element Analysis, enabling a parametric simulation workflow within the CAD environment.

tools.name: StressTopOpt
tools.one_line_profile: Efficient 3D sensitivity analysis code for stress-based topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: A compact MATLAB implementation for stress-based topology optimization, providing an efficient 3D sensitivity analysis solver often used as a reference or baseline in topology optimization research.

tools.name: PtFEM.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia implementation of 'Programming the Finite Element Method' library
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing the finite element methods and algorithms described in the textbook 'Programming the Finite Element Method' by Smith, Griffiths, and Margetts, serving as an educational and functional FEM library.

tools.name: PDLSM-FEM_mpi
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel coupled Peridynamics and FEM solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel C++ solver implementing adaptively coupled Peridynamics Least Squares Minimization (PDLSM) and Finite Element Method (FEM) for 2D and 3D structural analysis, supporting MPI parallelism.

tools.name: FEM2D
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB code for 2D Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of the Finite Element Method (FEM) for 2D problems, serving as a lightweight solver for educational or basic research purposes.

tools.name: xpfem
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for Finite Element Method in solid mechanics
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for performing Finite Element Method (FEM) simulations specifically tailored for solid mechanics problems.

tools.name: RBniCS
tools.one_line_profile: Reduced Order Modelling in FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of reduced order modelling (ROM) techniques (such as the reduced basis method) within the FEniCS finite element framework, enabling efficient simulation of parametrized PDEs.

tools.name: redback
tools.one_line_profile: Rock Mechanics with Dissipative Feedbacks (MOOSE module)
tools.detailed_description: A module built on the MOOSE framework for simulating rock mechanics with dissipative feedbacks, designed for coupled multi-physics simulations in geomechanics.

tools.name: torch-diffsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A minimal, parallelizable physics simulator written entirely in PyTorch, supporting automatic differentiation for physics-based learning and optimization tasks.

tools.name: SCI-Solver_FEM
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated FEM linear system solver
tools.detailed_description: A C++/CUDA library developed by the SCI Institute for solving Finite Element Method (FEM) linear systems efficiently using GPU hardware acceleration.

tools.name: SIMO-Package
tools.one_line_profile: NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) package
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB package implementing NURBS-based IsoGeometric Analysis (IGA) for educational and research purposes in computational mechanics.

tools.name: SciBlend
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific data visualization workflows in Blender
tools.detailed_description: A tool enabling advanced scientific data visualization workflows within Blender, allowing researchers to render high-quality visualizations of simulation and experimental data.

tools.name: FractionalDiffEq.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fractional Differential Equation solver in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for solving Fractional Differential Equations (FDEs) using high-performance numerical methods.

tools.name: FEniCS.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia wrapper for the FEniCS Finite Element library
tools.detailed_description: A Scientific Machine Learning (SciML) wrapper that provides an interface to the FEniCS Finite Element library within the Julia programming language.

tools.name: HighDimPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for high-dimensional PDEs using Deep BSDE methods
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing Deep Backwards Stochastic Differential Equation (Deep BSDE) and Feynman-Kac methods to solve high-dimensional Partial Differential Equations, overcoming the curse of dimensionality.

tools.name: MethodOfLines.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Finite Difference PDE solver for Julia SciML
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package that automates the solution of Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using the Method of Lines (MOL) via finite difference discretizations, integrated with the SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: NeuralPDE.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) solver
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for solving Partial Differential Equations using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) and other scientific machine learning methods, part of the Julia SciML ecosystem.

tools.name: sedfoam
tools.one_line_profile: Two-phase flow sediment transport solver for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A specialized solver for the OpenFOAM toolbox designed to simulate two-phase flow sediment transport processes.

tools.name: Sectrics
tools.one_line_profile: Truss analysis software using Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: A software application written in C# for analyzing truss structures using the Finite Element Method (FEM).

tools.name: XFEM_Fracture2D
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB XFEM solver for 2D fracture propagation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB program for solving fracture problems involving arbitrary multiple crack propagations in 2D linear-elastic solids using the Extended Finite Element Method (XFEM).

tools.name: SBFEM-UEL
tools.one_line_profile: Abaqus user element for Scaled Boundary Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a polyhedral user element (UEL) for ABAQUS based on the Scaled Boundary Finite Element Method (SBFEM), enabling SBFEM capabilities within commercial FEA software.

tools.name: RapidCFD
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated OpenFOAM fork
tools.detailed_description: A fork of OpenFOAM designed to run fully on CUDA platforms, providing GPU acceleration for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations.

tools.name: fastNLfea
tools.one_line_profile: Fast nonlinear FEA for topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based fast nonlinear Finite Element Analysis (FEA) solver specifically tailored for topology optimization applications.

tools.name: SlicerCBM
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Biophysics for Medicine extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the 3D Slicer platform that provides tools for computational biophysics and medical simulation, enabling biomechanical modeling directly within the medical imaging environment.

tools.name: JAX-CPFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Crystal Plasticity FEM using JAX
tools.detailed_description: An efficient, GPU-accelerated simulation tool for differentiable Crystal Plasticity Finite Element Method (CPFEM) implemented using JAX, suitable for materials science research.

tools.name: Swan
tools.one_line_profile: Topology Optimization Laboratory in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based tool for topology optimization, providing a collection of methods and solvers for structural optimization research.

tools.name: varFEM
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB Finite Element Method library
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB package providing finite element method implementations, serving as a functional library for educational and research applications in computational mechanics.

tools.name: MetaOpenFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based multi-agent framework for OpenFOAM CFD
tools.detailed_description: A multi-agent framework leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate and control OpenFOAM CFD simulations, facilitating natural language interaction with CFD workflows.

tools.name: SCEMa
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled FE-MD solver using Deal.II and LAMMPS
tools.detailed_description: A Heterogeneous Multiscale Method (HMM) implementation that couples the Deal.II finite element library with the LAMMPS molecular dynamics simulator for multiscale material simulations.

tools.name: TopologyOptimizationToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB toolbox for 3D structural topology optimization using unstructured meshes
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based toolbox designed for performing 3D structural topology optimization. It utilizes unstructured meshes to solve optimization problems, suitable for engineering design and structural analysis.

tools.name: WENOEXT
tools.one_line_profile: WENO scheme library extension for OpenFOAM framework
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that implements Weighted Essentially Non-Oscillatory (WENO) schemes within the OpenFOAM framework. It enhances OpenFOAM's capability to handle high-speed compressible flows with shock waves by providing high-order numerical schemes.

tools.name: FEMAddOns
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method extensions for Wolfram Language
tools.detailed_description: A collection of packages and functions that extend the Finite Element Method (FEM) capabilities of the Wolfram Language (Mathematica). It provides additional utilities for mesh generation, boundary condition handling, and post-processing for FEM analysis.

tools.name: SPHinXsys
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics simulation library based on Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for engineering simulation and optimization using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It provides a unified framework for modeling complex systems involving fluid dynamics, solid mechanics, and fluid-structure interactions (FSI).

tools.name: IGA-Contact
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric analysis code for 2D statics and contact problems
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based finite element code implementing Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) for 2D static structural analysis and contact mechanics. It utilizes NURBS basis functions and the Penalty method for handling contact constraints.

tools.name: Lattice-Boltzmann-Method-GPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 3D Lattice Boltzmann CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver based on the Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM), optimized for NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA. It simulates steady and unsteady 3D single-phase flows with significantly higher speed compared to serial CPU implementations.

tools.name: intansv
tools.one_line_profile: Integrative analysis tool for structural variations in genomics
tools.detailed_description: An R package for the integrative analysis of structural variations (SVs) in genomic data. It facilitates the reading, annotation, and visualization of SVs predicted by various tools, supporting bioinformatics research.

tools.name: diffsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator for learning and control
tools.detailed_description: A scalable differentiable physics engine designed for integrating physics simulation with machine learning and control tasks. It allows for gradient-based optimization of physical parameters and control policies.

tools.name: ASIGA
tools.one_line_profile: Acoustic scattering solver using Isogeometric Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based software tool for simulating acoustic scattering problems using Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It leverages NURBS-based geometries for accurate wave propagation modeling.

tools.name: MOOSE
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-based framework for automated scientific hypothesis discovery
tools.detailed_description: A framework leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate the discovery of open-domain scientific hypotheses. It assists researchers in generating and refining research ideas based on existing literature and data.

tools.name: MOOSE-Chem
tools.one_line_profile: LLM framework for rediscovering chemistry hypotheses
tools.detailed_description: A specialized version of the MOOSE framework tailored for chemistry. It uses Large Language Models to rediscover and generate scientific hypotheses specifically within the chemical sciences domain.

tools.name: pyMOTO
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Python framework for topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: A modular and flexible Python framework designed for topology optimization. It allows users to construct optimization workflows using a block-based approach, facilitating research and development in structural design.

tools.name: trusspy
tools.one_line_profile: Nonlinear truss solver for structural mechanics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for the nonlinear finite element analysis of truss structures. It supports geometric nonlinearities and provides tools for solving and visualizing truss deformations and forces.

tools.name: IncompressibleNavierStokes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Incompressible Navier-Stokes solver in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia-based solver for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations. It leverages Julia's performance capabilities to provide efficient fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: stat-fem
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical finite element method tools for data-constrained problems
tools.detailed_description: A Python library developed by the Alan Turing Institute for solving data-constrained finite element problems. It integrates statistical methods with FEM to quantify uncertainty and incorporate observational data into physical models.

tools.name: jaxsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library written in JAX. It is designed for control and robot learning applications, enabling gradient-based optimization through physical simulations.

tools.name: pydens
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network framework for solving ODEs and PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for solving Ordinary and Partial Differential Equations (ODEs & PDEs) using neural networks. It simplifies the implementation of physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) and related deep learning-based solvers.

tools.name: emopt
tools.one_line_profile: Optimization suite for electromagnetic structures
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for optimizing the shape and topology of electromagnetic structures. It combines Maxwell's equations solvers with gradient-based optimization algorithms for photonics and RF design.

tools.name: moltres
tools.one_line_profile: Molten Salt Reactor simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A simulation code designed for modeling Molten Salt Reactors (MSRs). It solves coupled equations for neutronics and thermal-hydraulics relevant to MSR physics.

tools.name: PythonFOAM
tools.one_line_profile: In-situ data analysis and ML integration for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by Argonne National Laboratory that enables in-situ data analysis and machine learning integration with OpenFOAM. It allows Python scripts to interact with OpenFOAM simulations at runtime.

tools.name: TensorFlowFoam
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow C-API integration for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A library that integrates the TensorFlow C-API into OpenFOAM, enabling data-driven CFD algorithms. It allows researchers to embed trained neural networks directly into fluid dynamics solvers for turbulence modeling or flow control.

tools.name: Coupling_ABAQUS_MATLAB
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) coupling between Abaqus and MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A framework enabling the execution of Finite Element (FE) packages like Abaqus inside an online loop with MATLAB. It facilitates Software-in-the-Loop (SiL) simulations for structural design, multi-physical simulations, and control theory applications by using compiled FORTRAN subroutines as messengers.

tools.name: Apollo
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for 3D electromagnetics simulation using MFEM
tools.detailed_description: Apollo is a MOOSE-based application designed to enable 3D electromagnetics simulations. It leverages the MFEM finite element library to solve electromagnetic problems within the MOOSE framework ecosystem.

tools.name: torch-fenics
tools.one_line_profile: Interface coupling PyTorch with FEniCS for differentiable physics
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides an interface between PyTorch and FEniCS, enabling the integration of finite element simulations into machine learning pipelines. It allows for differentiable physics simulations and solving inverse problems using automatic differentiation.

tools.name: pinnfactory
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight framework for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)
tools.detailed_description: A framework for building Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) with symbolic PDE definitions using SymPy and PyTorch. It supports flexible neural architectures, inverse parameter estimation, and automatic loss generation from PDEs and boundary conditions.

tools.name: FBG-SimPlus
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation tool for Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors using FEM
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool for Fiber Bragg Grating (FBG) sensors based on Finite Element Method (FEM) models. It allows users to simulate reflection spectrums of FBG sensor arrays in response to stress, strain, and temperature, including temperature dependency emulation.

tools.name: CFDWARP
tools.one_line_profile: CFD solver for waves, reactions, and plasmas
tools.detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver designed for handling waves, chemical reactions, and plasmas. It provides capabilities for simulating complex fluid dynamics problems involving multi-physics phenomena.

tools.name: pyspa
tools.one_line_profile: Structural Path Analysis tool for input-output and process data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for conducting Structural Path Analysis (SPA) on square technological matrices of process or input-output data. It supports analysis using environmental, social, and financial satellites, typically used in Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) and Industrial Ecology.

tools.name: BreakSeq2
tools.one_line_profile: Ultrafast nucleotide-resolution analysis of structural variants
tools.detailed_description: A bioinformatics tool for ultrafast and accurate nucleotide-resolution analysis of structural variants in genomic data. It is designed to detect breakpoints and characterize structural variations.

tools.name: Isogeometric-BEM
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB code for Isogeometric Boundary Element Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation for Isogeometric Boundary Element Method (IGABEM) analysis. It provides tools for performing boundary element analysis using isogeometric concepts, suitable for research and educational purposes in computational mechanics.

tools.name: FLOWVPM.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Meshless large eddy simulation using reformulated vortex particle method
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for meshless Large Eddy Simulation (LES) using the reformulated Vortex Particle Method (VPM). It is designed for high-fidelity fluid dynamics simulations without the need for traditional mesh generation.

tools.name: pyiga
tools.one_line_profile: Python research toolbox for Isogeometric Analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based research toolbox dedicated to Isogeometric Analysis (IGA). It provides functionalities for implementing and testing IGA methods, suitable for computational mechanics research.

tools.name: Cubit-CalculiX
tools.one_line_profile: Coreform Cubit component for CalculiX pre- and post-processing
tools.detailed_description: A component for Coreform Cubit that enables pre- and post-processing for the CalculiX solver. It facilitates the conversion of results to ParaView formats and integrates CalculiX workflows into the Cubit environment.

tools.name: beso
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization tool using CalculiX FEM solver
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for performing topology optimization using the Bi-directional Evolutionary Structural Optimization (BESO) method, coupled with the CalculiX FEM solver.

tools.name: CalculiX Advanced Environment (CAE)
tools.one_line_profile: Environment for creating CalculiX input files
tools.detailed_description: CalculiX Advanced Environment is a tool designed to guide users through the process of creating correct input files (keywords) for the CalculiX solver, helping to reduce errors in simulation setup.

tools.name: ccx2paraview
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from CalculiX results to ParaView VTK/VTU format
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert CalculiX analysis results (.frd files) into ParaView compatible formats (VTK/VTU). It also calculates Mises and Principal components for stress and strain tensors during conversion.

tools.name: gmsh2ccx
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Gmsh mesh format to CalculiX input format
tools.detailed_description: A Python utility to convert mesh files from Gmsh format to CalculiX input format (.inp), facilitating the use of Gmsh as a pre-processor for CalculiX.

tools.name: pygccx
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for Gmsh and CalculiX FEM workflow
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework to build, solve, and post-process finite element models. It integrates Gmsh for meshing and CalculiX for solving, specifically targeting 3D solid elements.

tools.name: unv2ccx
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Salome UNV mesh to CalculiX INP format
tools.detailed_description: A tool to convert meshes from Salome's universal format (UNV) to the CalculiX input format (INP), enabling the use of Salome as a pre-processor for CalculiX.

tools.name: IGAPack
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB library for Isogeometric Analysis with hierarchical refinements
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB library for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) that supports hierarchical refinements, providing tools for advanced computational mechanics research.

tools.name: isogeometric-analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Codebase for Isogeometric Analysis and FEM
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB codebase implementing Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) and Finite Element Method (FEM) algorithms, suitable for research and development in numerical analysis.

tools.name: rodin
tools.one_line_profile: Modern C++20 finite element method and shape optimization framework
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, modular, and extensible C++20 framework for finite element analysis and shape optimization, focusing on clean architecture and modern language features.

tools.name: TrioCFD
tools.one_line_profile: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) code based on the TRUST platform
tools.detailed_description: An open-source CFD code developed by CEA, featuring Front-Tracking, Radiation, ALE for fluid-structure interactions, and Turbulence LES & RANS models.

tools.name: FEMM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Method Magnetics solver
tools.detailed_description: A Windows finite element solver for 2D and axisymmetric magnetic, electrostatic, heat flow, and current flow problems, including graphical pre- and post-processors.

tools.name: CAN-PINN
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled-Automatic-Numerical differentiation scheme for PINNs
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a Coupled-Automatic-Numerical differentiation scheme for physics-informed neural networks (PINN) to improve training efficiency and accuracy.

tools.name: cfd3d
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Incompressible Navier-Stokes CFD Solver
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver implementing the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations in three dimensions.

tools.name: cideMOD
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based battery simulation framework using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A tool for solving DFN physicochemical equations for battery simulations using Finite Element methods, supporting thermal and degradation models.

tools.name: biome
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental Moose-based BioPerl implementation
tools.detailed_description: An experimental implementation of BioPerl functionalities using the Moose object system for bioinformatics data processing.

tools.name: dflo
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin solver for compressible flows
tools.detailed_description: A C++ solver implementing the Discontinuous Galerkin method for simulating compressible fluid flows.

tools.name: SmoothParticleNets
tools.one_line_profile: Deep network layers for particle-based fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A set of custom PyTorch deep network layers designed to enable computation with unordered particle sets, emphasizing fluid dynamics applications.

tools.name: Foam-Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-agent framework for automating OpenFOAM simulations
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end, composable multi-agent framework designed to automate Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations within OpenFOAM.

tools.name: fusionforce
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine for robot-terrain interaction
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine that fuses RGB and LiDAR data to predict robot-terrain interactions, developed by CTU-VRAS.

tools.name: MonoForce
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable Image-conditioned Physics Engine
tools.detailed_description: A physics engine that learns from image data to simulate physical interactions, presented at IROS 2024 and ICML 2024 Workshop.

tools.name: teseo
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analysis of structural dynamic graphs
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed for the analysis of structural dynamic graphs, developed by CWI.

tools.name: PetIGA
tools.one_line_profile: PETSc-based framework for isogeometric analysis
tools.detailed_description: A framework built on top of PETSc for implementing Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) methods, providing high-performance computing capabilities.

tools.name: igakit
tools.one_line_profile: NURBS surfaces and volumes for isogeometric analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for generating and manipulating NURBS geometries specifically for Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) applications.

tools.name: classy_blocks
tools.one_line_profile: Python classes for OpenFOAM blockMesh creation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the creation of OpenFOAM's blockMesh dictionaries, enabling programmatic mesh generation.

tools.name: evoxels
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics framework for voxel-based microstructure simulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics framework designed for simulating voxel-based microstructures, enabling gradient-based optimization of material properties.

tools.name: tIGAr
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric analysis library using FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) within the FEniCS finite element framework.

tools.name: PyBSASeq
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithm for BSA-Seq data analysis
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing a novel algorithm for Bulked Segregant Analysis Sequencing (BSA-Seq) data analysis to detect significant structural variants.

tools.name: deal.II
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ software library supporting the creation of finite element codes and an open community of users and developers.

tools.name: jax-fem
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Finite Element Method with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable Finite Element Method (FEM) library implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and inverse problems in physics simulations.

tools.name: DELLY2
tools.one_line_profile: Structural variant discovery tool
tools.detailed_description: An integrated paired-end and split-read analysis tool for the discovery of structural variants in genomic sequencing data.

tools.name: Viola-SV
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization tool for genomic structural variant signatures
tools.detailed_description: Viola is a Python package designed for the analysis of genomic structural variant (SV) signatures. It provides flexible tools for reading, filtering, and visualizing SV data, facilitating the interpretation of complex genomic rearrangements.

tools.name: fenics_topopt_foam
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization framework combining OpenFOAM and FEniCS
tools.detailed_description: A topology optimization tool that integrates OpenFOAM for fluid dynamics and FEniCS/dolfin-adjoint for sensitivity analysis and optimization. It enables gradient-based topology optimization of fluid flows.

tools.name: DIPY
tools.one_line_profile: Library for analysis and visualization of medical imaging data
tools.detailed_description: DIPY is a comprehensive Python library for the analysis of 3D/4D+ medical imaging data. It specializes in diffusion MRI, offering methods for reconstruction, tracking, registration, and statistical analysis.

tools.name: usv_sim_lsa
tools.one_line_profile: Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) simulation environment
tools.detailed_description: A simulation package for Unmanned Surface Vehicles (USVs) running on Gazebo. It models water currents, winds, and vehicle dynamics to support robotics research and algorithm testing.

tools.name: flexFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element solver for large deformations in soft materials
tools.detailed_description: flexFEM is an open-source finite element solver designed for modeling large deformations in soft materials. It provides implementations in both MATLAB and Fortran, suitable for prototyping and high-performance computing.

tools.name: DL4TO
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library for 3D topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: DL4TO is a Python library based on PyTorch for 3D topology optimization. It facilitates the integration of deep learning models with topology optimization tasks, supporting differentiable physics and neural network training.

tools.name: LevelSetSwirlFEMandFVM
tools.one_line_profile: Level set modeling of multi-phase flow using FEM and FVM
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based solver for modeling multi-phase flow in velocity fields using Finite Element (FEM) and Finite Volume (FVM) methods, specifically utilizing level set methods for interface tracking.

tools.name: Dojo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine for robotics
tools.detailed_description: Dojo.jl is a differentiable physics engine written in Julia, designed for robotics simulation and control. It supports gradients for physical simulation, enabling optimization and learning-based control approaches.

tools.name: PHiLiP
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel High-Order Library for PDEs using Discontinuous Galerkin methods
tools.detailed_description: PHiLiP is a C++ library for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using hp-adaptive Discontinuous Galerkin methods. It is designed for high-performance parallel computing.

tools.name: pyccx
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for CalculiX FEA simulations
tools.detailed_description: pyccx is a Python library that facilitates creating and running 3D Finite Element Analysis (FEA) simulations using the open-source CalculiX package. It provides a programmatic interface for defining models and executing solvers.

tools.name: NebulaSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume and Discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: NebulaSEM is a C++ solver implementing Finite Volume (FV) and high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods for computational fluid dynamics and other PDE-based problems.

tools.name: EasyGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Library for advanced network analysis and graph processing
tools.detailed_description: EasyGraph is an open-source Python library for network analysis. It provides functionalities for detecting structural hole spanners, network embedding, and various classic network analysis techniques, optimized for performance.

tools.name: prism
tools.one_line_profile: C++ Computational Fluid Dynamics library based on FVM
tools.detailed_description: Prism is a C++ library for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) utilizing the finite volume method (FVM). It provides a framework for developing and running fluid simulations.

tools.name: ofxCeres
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFrameworks wrapper for Google Ceres Solver
tools.detailed_description: ofxCeres is an addon for OpenFrameworks that interfaces with the Google Ceres non-linear least squares solver. It includes models for scientific and engineering tasks such as structural analysis, kinematics, and calibration.

tools.name: RL2Grid
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for reinforcement learning in power grid operations
tools.detailed_description: RL2Grid is a standardized benchmark environment for reinforcement learning agents in power grid management. It models real-time operations like topology optimization and redispatching with AC power flow simulation.

tools.name: OneFLOW
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale multiphysics scientific simulation environment
tools.detailed_description: OneFLOW is a scientific simulation environment focused on Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) and multiphysics problems. It is designed for large-scale simulations.

tools.name: Tiny Differentiable Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Header-only C++ and CUDA differentiable physics library for robotics and RL
tools.detailed_description: A zero-dependency, header-only C++ and CUDA physics library designed for reinforcement learning and robotics. It provides a differentiable simulator enabling gradient-based optimization for physical systems.

tools.name: ExaDG
tools.one_line_profile: High-Order Discontinuous Galerkin solver for Exa-Scale simulations
tools.detailed_description: ExaDG is a high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver framework designed for exascale computing, focusing on efficient parallel solution of partial differential equations.

tools.name: Exasim
tools.one_line_profile: Code generator for Discontinuous Galerkin simulations
tools.detailed_description: Exasim is a tool for generating Discontinuous Galerkin codes optimized for extreme scalable simulations, facilitating the creation of high-performance PDE solvers.

tools.name: BinauralSDM
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for rendering Binaural Room Impulse Responses using Spatial Decomposition Method
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools to render Binaural Room Impulse Responses (BRIR) using the Spatial Decomposition Method (SDM), featuring improvements for DOA estimation and reverberation equalization.

tools.name: femR
tools.one_line_profile: R package for solving PDEs using the Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed for solving Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) using the finite element method, bringing FEM capabilities to the R statistical environment.

tools.name: fempar
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Finite Element Multiphysics solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library of parallel finite element solvers for multiphysics problems, designed for high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: FESTIM
tools.one_line_profile: Coupled hydrogen/tritium transport and heat transfer modelling tool
tools.detailed_description: A FEniCS-based tool for modelling coupled hydrogen/tritium transport and heat transfer, primarily used in fusion energy research.

tools.name: Firedrake
tools.one_line_profile: Automated system for solving PDEs using the Finite Element Method
tools.detailed_description: Firedrake is an automated system for the portable solution of partial differential equations using the finite element method (FEM), utilizing code generation for high performance.

tools.name: qgis2fds
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to export GIS data to NIST FDS for CFD simulations
tools.detailed_description: An open source tool to export terrain elevation, landuse, and georeferencing data from QGIS to NIST FDS format for computational fluid dynamics (CFD) wildfire or dispersion simulations.

tools.name: FLEXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for conservation laws
tools.detailed_description: FLEXI is a high order discontinuous Galerkin framework designed for solving hyperbolic-parabolic conservation laws on HPC systems.

tools.name: GALÆXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for compressible flows on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: GALÆXI is a high order discontinuous Galerkin framework specifically optimized for simulating compressible flows on GPU systems.

tools.name: Relexi
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable reinforcement learning framework for CFD
tools.detailed_description: A scalable reinforcement learning framework designed to interface with CFD solvers on HPC systems for flow control and optimization tasks.

tools.name: fluidfoam
tools.one_line_profile: OpenFoam postprocessing Python tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for post-processing OpenFOAM simulation data, enabling easy data manipulation and visualization in Python.

tools.name: fluidsim
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for studying fluid dynamics with numerical simulations
tools.detailed_description: A framework for studying fluid dynamics using numerical simulations in Python, supporting various solvers and pseudo-spectral methods.

tools.name: rheoTool
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox to simulate GNF and viscoelastic fluid flows in OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox developed to simulate Generalized Newtonian Fluid (GNF) and viscoelastic fluid flows within the OpenFOAM framework.

tools.name: STAN
tools.one_line_profile: C#/.NET Finite Element Software
tools.detailed_description: STAN (Structural Analyser) is a Finite Element Analysis (FEA) software written in C#/.NET for structural simulation.

tools.name: Phaseflow
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of convection-coupled melting and solidification
tools.detailed_description: Phaseflow is a FEniCS-based simulation tool for modeling the convection-coupled melting and solidification of phase-change materials (PCM).

tools.name: foamlib
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for interacting with OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: A modern Python package that provides an interface for interacting with OpenFOAM cases and runners, facilitating automation and scripting of CFD workflows.

tools.name: OpenFOAM for macOS
tools.one_line_profile: Native OpenFOAM distribution for macOS
tools.detailed_description: A native distribution of the OpenFOAM CFD toolbox for macOS, enabling researchers to run simulations directly on Mac hardware without virtualization.

tools.name: G+Smo
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for isogeometric analysis (IGA)
tools.detailed_description: G+Smo (Geometry plus Simulation modules) is a C++ library for isogeometric analysis (IGA), aiming to seamlessly integrate Computer-aided Design (CAD) and Finite Element Analysis (FEA).

tools.name: Goma
tools.one_line_profile: Full-Newton Finite Element Program for multiphysics problems
tools.detailed_description: A Full-Newton Finite Element Program designed for free and moving boundary problems involving coupled fluid/solid momentum, energy, mass, and chemical species transport.

tools.name: Brax
tools.one_line_profile: Massively parallel rigidbody physics simulation on accelerator hardware
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine that simulates massive parallel rigidbody physics on hardware accelerators (GPUs/TPUs), designed for reinforcement learning and robotics research.

tools.name: Ceviche Challenges
tools.one_line_profile: Photonic inverse design challenge problems for topology optimization
tools.detailed_description: A suite of photonic inverse design benchmark problems and datasets for evaluating topology optimization algorithms, including simulation environments.

tools.name: GridapEmbedded.jl

tools.detailed_description: An extension to the Gridap.jl library providing embedded finite element methods (CutFEM) for solving PDEs on complex geometries.

tools.name: GridapMHD.jl

tools.detailed_description: A specialized Finite Element Method (FEM) solver for Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) equations, built on top of the Gridap.jl ecosystem in Julia.

tools.name: sparselizard

tools.detailed_description: A fast, user-friendly, and multiphysics finite element C++ library running on Linux, Mac and Windows. It features hp-adaptive capabilities and is designed for high-performance computing.

tools.name: Abaqus-PhaseField-UEL

tools.name: PENGoLINS

tools.name: PyPDE

tools.detailed_description: A library for solving systems of hyperbolic or parabolic Partial Differential Equations, capable of handling stiff source terms and non-conservative components.

tools.name: spherical-PDE-solver
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral method solver for PDEs on spherical surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A numerical program that solves Partial Differential Equations on a spherical surface using spectral methods based on spherical harmonics.

tools.name: HPDDM

tools.detailed_description: An efficient framework for high-performance domain decomposition methods (DDM), often used as a solver backend for finite element analysis.

tools.name: hyStrath

tools.detailed_description: A simulation code built on the MOOSE framework for modeling degradation processes in concrete and other structural materials.

tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application for modeling and simulation of advanced manufacturing processes.

tools.detailed_description: A MOOSE-based application designed for structural dynamics, seismic analysis, and risk assessment of structures.

tools.detailed_description: A Matlab library implementing Isogeometric Analysis methods for numerical solution of PDEs.

tools.detailed_description: A software environment for Discontinuous Galerkin methods, designed for solving partial differential equations.

tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics (CFD) workbench for FreeCAD that integrates the OpenFOAM solver, allowing users to set up, run, and visualize CFD simulations directly within the FreeCAD environment.

tools.detailed_description: A browser-based finite element analysis tool for 2D structures, enabling users to calculate and visualize bending moments, shear forces, and deflections for beams and trusses without installation.

tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool built on the MOOSE framework that couples phase field methods with crystal plasticity to model microstructure evolution and mechanical response in materials.

tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a diffusion-based generative model for solving partial differential equations (PDEs), specifically designed to handle scenarios with partial observations and generate consistent solution fields.

tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics-based framework for efficient motion mimicking, allowing for the optimization of control policies and physical parameters to replicate reference motions in simulated environments.

tools.detailed_description: A Python-based framework for 3D topology optimization using the Solid Isotropic Material with Penalization (SIMP) method, facilitating structural design optimization.

tools.detailed_description: A collection of MATLAB functions and utilities for performing Nonlinear Isogeometric Analysis (IGA), bridging computer-aided design (CAD) and finite element analysis (FEA).

tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to assist in the development of input files and the post-processing of simulation data produced by the Fire Dynamics Simulator (FDS).

tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed to simplify the process of solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using deep learning methods, specifically Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs).
