tools.name: DnaFeaturesViewer
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for visualizing DNA sequence features
tools.detailed_description: DnaFeaturesViewer is a Python library designed to produce publication-ready plots of DNA sequences and their features (e.g., from Genbank files). It is widely used in bioinformatics for visualizing genetic constructs and sequence annotations.

tools.name: fespp
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for visualizing Energistics RESQML reservoir data
tools.detailed_description: fespp is a ParaView plugin developed by F2I Consulting that allows for the loading and visualization of RESQML data formats, which are standard in the reservoir engineering and geoscience domains.

tools.name: AMI
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript toolkit for medical imaging visualization
tools.detailed_description: AMI (AMI Medical Imaging) is a JavaScript toolkit for parsing, processing, and visualizing medical imaging data (such as DICOM) directly in the web browser using WebGL. It enables the development of web-based medical viewers.

tools.name: FlowmapBlue
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based tool for interactive flow map visualization
tools.detailed_description: FlowmapBlue is a tool for visualizing origin-destination movement data (flow maps). It is used in urban science, geography, and transportation research to analyze and visualize mobility patterns.

tools.name: GENIE Generator
tools.one_line_profile: Universal neutrino interaction event generator
tools.detailed_description: The GENIE Generator is a large-scale physics simulation tool used for modeling neutrino interactions. It serves as a primary event generator for many high-energy physics experiments, handling flux, geometry, and event generation.

tools.name: GLVis
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight OpenGL tool for finite element visualization
tools.detailed_description: GLVis is a lightweight OpenGL-based tool designed for the accurate and flexible visualization of finite element meshes and fields. It supports high-order elements and is often used in conjunction with the MFEM library.

tools.name: glvis-js
tools.one_line_profile: WebAssembly port of the GLVis visualization library
tools.detailed_description: glvis-js is the JavaScript/WebAssembly version of GLVis, enabling high-performance finite element visualization directly in web browsers.

tools.name: pyglvis
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter Widget for GLVis visualization
tools.detailed_description: pyglvis provides a Python interface and Jupyter Widget for GLVis, allowing users to visualize finite element data interactively within Python environments and Jupyter notebooks.

tools.name: Asclepios DICOM Viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop DICOM viewer for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: Asclepios is a medical imaging viewer developed in C++, Qt, and VTK. It allows for the visualization and manipulation of DICOM files, supporting 2D and 3D viewing modes.

tools.name: hedgehog-lab
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based scientific computing and visualization environment
tools.detailed_description: hedgehog-lab is an open-source scientific computing environment that runs entirely in the browser. It allows users to write JavaScript for matrix operations, symbolic computation, and data visualization, similar to a web-based MATLAB or Mathematica.

tools.name: AttentionLens-LVLM
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for attention flow in Large Vision-Language Models
tools.detailed_description: AttentionLens-LVLM is a toolkit designed to visualize and analyze the attention mechanisms within Large Vision-Language Models. It helps researchers diagnose model behaviors by rendering token-to-token attention maps and cross-modal attention paths.

tools.name: ImagePy
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin-based image processing framework
tools.detailed_description: ImagePy is an open-source image processing framework written in Python. It mimics the plugin architecture of ImageJ, allowing easy integration with scientific libraries like NumPy, SciPy, and scikit-image for building custom image analysis workflows.

tools.name: myvi
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight 3D visualization library based on VTK
tools.detailed_description: myvi is a simplified and lightweight Python library for 3D visualization, built on top of VTK. It aims to provide a more accessible interface for scientific visualization tasks compared to heavier alternatives like Mayavi.

tools.name: skillet
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive scientific visualization application in Rust
tools.detailed_description: skillet is a lightweight, standalone application written in Rust for interactive scientific visualization. It focuses on performance and ease of use for visualizing scientific data.

tools.name: GLVisualize.jl
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance visualization library for Julia using OpenGL
tools.detailed_description: A visualization library written in Julia and OpenGL, designed for high-performance rendering of scientific data, including 2D/3D plots, particles, and meshes.

tools.name: MeshViz.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization recipes for Meshes.jl using Makie.jl
tools.detailed_description: Provides Makie.jl recipes for visualizing geometric meshes defined by the Meshes.jl library, facilitating the inspection of computational geometry and finite element meshes.

tools.name: Meshing.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Isosurface extraction and meshing algorithms for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing algorithms for isosurface extraction (e.g., Marching Cubes, Marching Tetrahedra) from volumetric data, essential for generating meshes for simulation or visualization.

tools.name: Molly.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics simulation framework in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A pure Julia package for molecular dynamics simulations, supporting various force fields, integrators, and analysis tools for physical and chemical systems.

tools.name: OceanRobots.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for oceanographic robot data analysis and simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for the analysis, processing, and simulation of data generated by scientific robots in the ocean, supporting oceanographic research.

tools.name: MeshCatMechanisms.jl
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualization of robotic mechanisms and URDFs
tools.detailed_description: Provides 3D visualization of mechanisms and URDF files using MeshCat.jl and RigidBodyDynamics.jl, useful for robotics simulation and analysis.

tools.name: VTKDataIO.jl
tools.one_line_profile: IO library for VTK mesh data in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A package for reading, writing, and visualizing mesh data in Julia, providing an interface to Python's VTK library for interoperability.

tools.name: WriteVTK.jl
tools.one_line_profile: VTK XML file writer for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for writing VTK XML files (vtu, vtp, vts, etc.), enabling the export of simulation data for visualization in ParaView or VisIt.

tools.name: pythonInteractAbaqus
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for Abaqus pre/post-processing
tools.detailed_description: A general pre- and post-processing framework for finite element analysis software like ABAQUS and OpenSees, automating simulation workflows.

tools.name: K3D-jupyter
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualization widget for Jupyter notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter widget for creating 3D plots backed by WebGL, supporting surfaces, isosurfaces, voxels, meshes, and VTK objects for interactive scientific visualization.

tools.name: 3DVisualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive 3D visualization for multivariate gridded data
tools.detailed_description: A highly interactive application for visualization and analysis of 3D multivariate gridded data from FEM simulations, microscopy, or medical imaging.

tools.name: PCLPlugin
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for Point Cloud Library (PCL) integration
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that enables Point Cloud Library (PCL) functionality within ParaView, allowing for advanced processing and visualization of point cloud data.

tools.name: ParaView
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-platform data analysis and visualization application
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, multi-platform data analysis and visualization application based on VTK, designed to analyze extremely large datasets using distributed memory computing resources.

tools.name: ParaViewTangoRecorder
tools.one_line_profile: Data recording app for Project Tango and ParaView
tools.detailed_description: An application for the Project Tango development kit to record 3D data for visualization and analysis in ParaView.

tools.name: VTK
tools.one_line_profile: The Visualization Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization, serving as the foundation for ParaView and many other scientific tools.

tools.name: VolView
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based 3D radiological viewer
tools.detailed_description: A 3D radiological viewer for DICOM data, volume rendering, and annotations, running entirely in the browser.

tools.name: Glance
tools.one_line_profile: Web application for visualizing volumetric and geometric data
tools.detailed_description: An open-source web application for visualizing volumetric images, molecular structures, geometric objects, and point clouds, built on VTK.js and ITK.js.

tools.name: itk-vtk-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: 2D/3D web image and mesh viewer
tools.detailed_description: A web-based viewer for images, meshes, and point sets using itk-wasm and vtk.js, suitable for medical and scientific data visualization.

tools.name: ParaView Lite
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight web client for ParaView
tools.detailed_description: A lite web client for a ParaView server, enabling remote visualization and analysis via web technologies.

tools.name: paraview-trame-components
tools.one_line_profile: Trame components for ParaView integration
tools.detailed_description: High-level components for building ParaView-based applications using the Trame framework.

tools.name: ParaViewWeb
tools.one_line_profile: Web framework for VTK/ParaView visualization
tools.detailed_description: A web framework for building interactive visualization applications relying on VTK or ParaView to produce visualization data.

tools.name: py-web-vue
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based 3D web application builder using VTK/ParaView
tools.detailed_description: A library to build 3D web applications using VTK or ParaView by writing only Python scripts, streamlining the creation of visualization tools.

tools.name: Trame
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for visual analytics web applications
tools.detailed_description: A framework that allows creating interactive web applications for visual analytics and scientific visualization solely using Python, integrating with VTK and ParaView.

tools.name: trame-vtk
tools.one_line_profile: VTK and ParaView widgets for Trame
tools.detailed_description: Provides VTK and ParaView widgets for the Trame framework, enabling 3D visualization components in Python-based web applications.

tools.name: trame-vtk3d
tools.one_line_profile: Trame wrapper for VTK WASM bundle
tools.detailed_description: A wrapper for the WASM bundle of VTK, enabling client-side VTK rendering within the Trame framework.

tools.name: vtk.js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript implementation of the Visualization Toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for 3D visualization, bringing VTK's rendering capabilities to the web browser.

tools.name: SlicerVirtualReality
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual Reality extension for 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: An extension for 3D Slicer that enables users to interact with Slicer scenes using virtual reality hardware, enhancing medical data visualization.

tools.name: ProteinFeatureAnalyzer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for extracting and visualizing protein structure features
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for extracting, analyzing, and visualizing features from protein structures, developed by the Kortemme Lab.

tools.name: ParaView-MCP
tools.one_line_profile: LLM-driven agent for ParaView visualization control
tools.detailed_description: Integrates multimodal Large Language Models (LLMs) with ParaView via the Model Context Protocol, enabling natural language control and automation of scientific visualizations.

tools.name: Easy3D
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight C++ library for processing and rendering 3D data
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, easy-to-use, and efficient library for processing and rendering 3D data, supporting both C++ and Python interfaces. It provides tools for mesh processing, geometry analysis, and visualization.

tools.name: PushingVoxelsForward
tools.one_line_profile: Isosurface extraction library for volumetric data
tools.detailed_description: A C library implementing advanced techniques for isosurface extraction from volumetric data, focusing on performance and algorithm efficiency for scientific visualization.

tools.name: odb2vtk
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from Abaqus ODB to VTK format for ParaView
tools.detailed_description: A Python script designed to convert Abaqus ODB simulation result files into VTK format, enabling post-processing and visualization in open-source tools like ParaView.

tools.name: MeshLite
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight package for visualizing and editing meshes
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python package developed by MPI-IS for visualizing, editing, and saving 3D meshes, suitable for quick geometry processing tasks in research.

tools.name: VolumeRender
tools.one_line_profile: C++ implementation of volume rendering algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A C++ repository implementing volume rendering techniques, providing a codebase for visualizing 3D volumetric data.

tools.name: windtools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for wind simulation setup and analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Python package from NREL for setting up wind energy simulations, processing data, and performing analysis, specifically tailored for wind research.

tools.name: ParaViewConnector
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugin for NVIDIA Omniverse integration
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for Kitware ParaView that adds support for NVIDIA Omniverse and USD (Universal Scene Description) export, enabling advanced visualization workflows.

tools.name: gvdb-voxels
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse volume compute and rendering library
tools.detailed_description: NVIDIA GVDB Voxels is a library for sparse volume computation and rendering on GPUs, designed for high-performance simulation and visualization of volumetric data.

tools.name: ipyparaview
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter widget for server-side ParaView rendering
tools.detailed_description: An iPython widget that enables server-side ParaView rendering directly within Jupyter notebooks, facilitating interactive scientific visualization in web-based workflows.

tools.name: sim-web-visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based visualizer for simulation environments
tools.detailed_description: A web-based tool developed by NVIDIA Research for visualizing simulation environments and data, enabling remote inspection and analysis of simulation results.

tools.name: h5utils
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for HDF5 data visualization and conversion
tools.detailed_description: A set of utilities for visualization and conversion of scientific data stored in the HDF5 format, including tools to convert HDF5 to VTK or image formats.

tools.name: NeuroMorph
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroscience analysis and visualization toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for the analysis and visualization of neuronal morphology, developed by EPFL, providing tools for processing and viewing complex biological structures.

tools.name: Vector-field-visualization-using-cuda
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time 3D vector field visualization using CUDA
tools.detailed_description: A C/CUDA implementation for real-time visualization of 3D vector fields using 3D textures, suitable for fluid dynamics or electromagnetic field visualization.

tools.name: VRVizualizer
tools.one_line_profile: Virtual reality visualization system for scientific data
tools.detailed_description: A C++ based virtual reality system designed specifically for the visualization and exploration of scientific datasets in an immersive environment.

tools.name: cellxgene-gateway
tools.one_line_profile: Gateway for multi-dataset Cellxgene Server deployment
tools.detailed_description: A gateway tool that allows serving multiple datasets using the Cellxgene Server (for single-cell data visualization), facilitating data management and access in bioinformatics research.

tools.name: sharevol
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight WebGL volume slicing and rendering
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript/WebGL library for lightweight volume slicing and rendering in the browser, enabling web-based visualization of volumetric scientific data.

tools.name: ParaViewGeo
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization software for geoscience
tools.detailed_description: A specialized visualization tool or plugin based on ParaView, tailored for the specific needs of geoscience data analysis and visualization.

tools.name: BioxelNodes
tools.one_line_profile: Volumetric data visualization in Blender
tools.detailed_description: A Blender add-on designed for scientific volumetric data visualization, allowing researchers to use Blender's rendering capabilities for scientific data.

tools.name: PVGeo
tools.one_line_profile: Python package of VTK-based algorithms for geoscientific data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing VTK-based algorithms and tools to analyze and visualize geoscientific data and models, often used in conjunction with PyVista or ParaView.

tools.name: geojs
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance visualization for geospatial datasets
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for high-performance visualization and interactive exploration of scientific and geospatial location-aware datasets in web environments.

tools.name: VaspPoscarMayavi
tools.one_line_profile: Mayavi visualization script for VASP POSCAR files
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool using Mayavi to visualize VASP POSCAR files, aiding in the structural analysis of materials science simulations.

tools.name: R3BRoot
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and analysis framework for R3B experiments
tools.detailed_description: A software framework based on ROOT for simulations and data analysis of R3B (Reactions with Relativistic Radioactive Beams) experiments at GSI/FAIR.

tools.name: VolumeRayCasting
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL 2 volume ray casting library
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing volume ray casting in WebGL 2, enabling high-quality volume rendering directly in web browsers for scientific data visualization.

tools.name: SCIRun
tools.one_line_profile: A Problem Solving Environment for modeling, simulation, and visualization of scientific problems
tools.detailed_description: SCIRun is a modular dataflow programming environment for simulation, modeling, and visualization. It allows users to interactively compose scientific workflows by connecting computational modules, specifically designed for biomedical and engineering applications.

tools.name: veux
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element visualization framework for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for visualizing finite element analysis (FEA) data. It provides tools to render meshes and simulation results, facilitating post-processing of engineering simulations.

tools.name: ScopeFoundry
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for controlling laboratory experiments and visualizing scientific data
tools.detailed_description: ScopeFoundry is a Python platform for controlling custom laboratory experiments and visualizing scientific data in real-time. It provides a framework for hardware control and data acquisition.

tools.name: Ketupa
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning automation for HFSS modeling and simulation
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning project applied to signal integrity and RF analysis. It provides automated modeling, simulation, and data storage wrappers for HFSS (High Frequency Structure Simulator), specifically for patch antennas, transmission lines, and connectors.

tools.name: SimVascular
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for medical image segmentation to blood flow simulation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive open-source software package providing a complete pipeline from medical image data segmentation to patient-specific blood flow simulation and analysis. It is widely used in cardiovascular modeling.

tools.name: 3D Slicer
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for medical image visualization and computing
tools.detailed_description: Multi-platform, free open source software for visualization and image computing. It is a standard tool for medical image analysis, visualization, and image-guided therapy.

tools.name: iFeatureOmega-CLI
tools.one_line_profile: Feature extraction platform for biological sequences and structures (CLI)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform for generating, analyzing, and visualizing representations for biological sequences, 3D structures, and ligands. This is the Command Line Interface version suitable for pipelines.

tools.name: iFeatureOmega-GUI
tools.one_line_profile: Feature extraction platform for biological sequences and structures (GUI)
tools.detailed_description: The Graphical User Interface version of iFeatureOmega, designed for generating, analyzing, and visualizing representations for biological sequences, 3D structures, and ligands.

tools.name: MeshSegNet
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for tooth segmentation on 3D meshes
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of MeshSegNet for automated tooth segmentation from intraoral scans (point cloud/mesh). It serves as a specialized tool for 3D medical mesh analysis.

tools.name: VisualFactory
tools.one_line_profile: Cinematic molecular visualization scripts
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts for molecular visualization designed to produce high-quality visuals with scientific accuracy. It bridges scientific data with cinematic rendering tools.

tools.name: VisTrails
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific workflow and provenance management system
tools.detailed_description: VisTrails is an open-source data analysis and visualization tool that provides a comprehensive provenance infrastructure. It maintains detailed history of the steps followed and data derived in exploratory scientific tasks.

tools.name: Volume-Unity-Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: Volume rendering plugin for Unity3D
tools.detailed_description: A Unity3D plugin for rendering volumetric data assets. It enables scientific volume visualization (e.g., medical scans, simulation fields) within the Unity engine.

tools.name: 3d-nii-visualizer
tools.one_line_profile: A NIfTI (nii.gz) 3D Visualizer using VTK and Qt5
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight 3D visualization tool specifically designed for NIfTI medical imaging data, utilizing VTK for rendering and Qt5 for the interface. It supports viewing and interacting with volumetric data common in medical physics and bio-engineering.

tools.name: robopy
tools.one_line_profile: Python port of the MATLAB Robotics Toolbox for kinematics and dynamics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Peter Corke's Robotics Toolbox, providing tools for kinematic and dynamic simulation of robotic arms and mobile robots. It supports transformation matrices, trajectory generation, and visualization.

tools.name: cloudtool
tools.one_line_profile: 3D point cloud processing and visualization software based on PCL and Qt
tools.detailed_description: A desktop application for processing and visualizing 3D point cloud data. It integrates the Point Cloud Library (PCL) algorithms for filtering, segmentation, and registration, providing a GUI for engineering and geomatics applications.

tools.name: vole-core
tools.one_line_profile: Core rendering and data loading services for the Vol-E volume viewer
tools.detailed_description: The core rendering engine and data management library for the Vol-E volume viewer, developed by the Allen Institute. It handles complex biological volume data visualization and interaction.

tools.name: AMEP
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for analyzing particle-based and continuum simulation data of soft and active matter
tools.detailed_description: The Active Matter Evaluation Package (AMEP) is a comprehensive library for post-processing and analyzing simulation data in soft matter physics. It supports various data formats and provides tools for structural and dynamical analysis.

tools.name: meshcat-cpp
tools.one_line_profile: C++ interface for the MeshCat WebGL-based 3D visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A C++ client wrapper for MeshCat, a remotely controllable 3D viewer. It allows C++ simulation and robotics applications to visualize geometries and trajectories in a web browser in real-time.

tools.name: nDTomo
tools.one_line_profile: Suite for simulation, visualization, and analysis of X-ray chemical imaging and tomography data
tools.detailed_description: A software suite designed for X-ray chemical imaging and tomography. It includes tools for simulation, data pre-processing, reconstruction analysis, and visualization, facilitating the study of complex material structures.

tools.name: SciColorMaps
tools.one_line_profile: Custom .NET color maps for scientific visualization
tools.detailed_description: A library providing scientific color maps (including matplotlib styles) for .NET applications. It is a specialized component for enhancing scientific data visualization in C# environments.

tools.name: F3DASM
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Data-Driven Design & Analysis of Structures & Materials
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework designed for the data-driven design and analysis of structures and materials. It facilitates the generation of datasets, integration with simulation tools, and application of machine learning for material science and structural engineering problems.

tools.name: rust-isosurface-extraction
tools.one_line_profile: Library for extracting meshes from voxel data using isosurface algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A Rust library that implements algorithms (like Marching Cubes) to convert volumetric voxel data into triangular meshes. This is a fundamental operation in scientific visualization, medical imaging, and CFD post-processing.

tools.name: Kitware.VTK (C# Wrapper)
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental C# wrapper for the Visualization Toolkit (VTK)
tools.detailed_description: A C# wrapper for Kitware's VTK (Visualization Toolkit), enabling .NET developers to utilize VTK's powerful scientific visualization and data processing capabilities. VTK is a standard library for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization in scientific computing.

tools.name: geovista-slam
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for generating Structured Local Area Model (SLAM) grids from unstructured meshes
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool within the geovista ecosystem for generating Structured Local Area Model (SLAM) grids from unstructured meshes, facilitating specific geospatial analysis and modeling tasks.

tools.name: BlenderNC
tools.one_line_profile: Blender addon to visualize scientific gridded data (NetCDF)
tools.detailed_description: A Blender add-on that enables the import and visualization of scientific gridded data, specifically NetCDF files. It allows scientists to use Blender's advanced rendering capabilities for oceanographic, atmospheric, and climate data visualization.

tools.name: fast-surface-nets-rs
tools.one_line_profile: Fast isosurface extraction algorithm implementation in Rust
tools.detailed_description: A Rust implementation of the Surface Nets algorithm for fast isosurface extraction from volumetric data. It produces high-quality meshes from voxel grids, suitable for scientific visualization and geometry processing.

tools.name: XLToolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Excel add-in for scientific data analysis and visualization
tools.detailed_description: An open-source add-in for Microsoft Excel designed to assist with scientific and technical data analysis and visualization. It provides tools for chart management, data analysis, and export, tailored for publication-quality figures.

tools.name: kMap.py
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and data analysis tool for photoemission tomography
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based program for simulation and data analysis in photoemission tomography (momentum microscopy). It handles data processing and visualization specific to this experimental technique in physics.

tools.name: BlenderGeoModeller
tools.one_line_profile: Blender add-on for 3D geological modelling and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Blender add-on providing tools for 3D geological modelling, primarily for mineral exploration. It supports importing drill hole data, point data, generating block models, and integrates with GemPy for implicit geological modelling.

tools.name: powsimR
tools.one_line_profile: Power analysis tool for RNA-seq experiments
tools.detailed_description: A flexible tool to simulate and evaluate differential expression from bulk and single-cell RNA-seq data. It is used for a priori and posterior power analyses to optimize experimental design in genomics.

tools.name: SphGLLTools
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for visualization and processing of GLL mesh tomographic models
tools.detailed_description: A toolbox for visualization, processing, and spherical harmonics analysis of tomographic models defined on Gauss-Lobatto-Legendre (GLL) meshes, commonly used in spectral element methods for geophysics.

tools.name: climakitae
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for analyzing and visualizing Cal-Adapt climate data
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed for retrieving, visualizing, and performing scientific analyses with climate data from the Cal-Adapt Analytics Engine. It simplifies access to complex climate datasets for researchers.

tools.name: feature-viewer
tools.one_line_profile: Library to visualize protein sequence features
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library using D3 to visualize protein sequence features. Developed by the SIB CALIPHO group for the neXtProt project, it allows for interactive display of biological annotations on protein sequences.

tools.name: samui
tools.one_line_profile: Performant scientific image visualization system
tools.detailed_description: A scientific image visualization system designed for performance. It likely handles large-scale image data typical in microscopy or other scientific imaging domains.

tools.name: cellxgene
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive explorer for single-cell transcriptomics data
tools.detailed_description: An interactive data explorer for single-cell transcriptomics data. It enables biologists to visualize and analyze large-scale single-cell datasets to understand cellular heterogeneity.

tools.name: mitsuba-visualize
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to visualize meshes and pointclouds using Mitsuba renderer
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool that leverages the Mitsuba renderer to create publication-quality visualizations of meshes, point clouds, and video flythroughs. It is useful for rendering scientific geometry data with high fidelity.

tools.name: Feature-Selection-Visualization
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for forward stepwise feature selection residuals
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool to plot residuals during forward stepwise feature selection. This helps in analyzing the performance and stability of feature selection processes in machine learning and statistical modeling.

tools.name: FeatureMap_Visualize_Pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to visualize feature maps in PyTorch models
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation for visualizing feature maps of convolutional neural networks. This is essential for interpreting and debugging deep learning models used in scientific AI applications.

tools.name: nexus
tools.one_line_profile: Library for creation and visualization of batched multiresolution meshes
tools.detailed_description: A C++/JavaScript library designed for the efficient creation and visualization of large-scale, batched multiresolution meshes. It supports streaming and rendering of massive geometric datasets, common in cultural heritage and scientific visualization.

tools.name: CTK
tools.one_line_profile: Common Toolkit for medical imaging and surgical navigation
tools.detailed_description: A set of common support code for medical imaging, surgical navigation, and related purposes. It provides widgets and libraries to build medical image analysis and visualization applications, often used in conjunction with VTK and ITK.

tools.name: compas_fea2
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Analysis toolbox for the COMPAS framework
tools.detailed_description: A package that extends the COMPAS framework to support Finite Element Analysis (FEA). It provides a unified interface to various FEA solvers (like Abaqus, Ansys, Opensees) for architectural and structural engineering research.

tools.name: AutoInt
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic Integration for Fast Neural Volume Rendering
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of AutoInt, a method for automatic integration to accelerate neural volume rendering. This is a research code for advanced visualization and rendering techniques using neural networks.

tools.name: Lab
tools.one_line_profile: HTML5-based scientific models and visualizations platform
tools.detailed_description: A platform for creating and running HTML5-based scientific models, visualizations, and graphing tools. It is primarily used for educational simulations in physics, chemistry, and biology, allowing for interactive exploration of scientific concepts.

tools.name: aphros
tools.one_line_profile: Finite volume solver for incompressible multiphase flows
tools.detailed_description: A finite volume solver designed for incompressible multiphase flows with surface tension. It is capable of simulating complex phenomena like foaming flows in complex geometries, suitable for fluid dynamics research.

tools.name: pyF3D
tools.one_line_profile: Image processing library for many-core platforms
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for high-performance image processing on many-core and multi-core platforms. It appears to be related to fast 3D imaging or processing tasks in scientific contexts (LBNL origin).

tools.name: pathgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization tool for ray tracing algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A tool for creating visualizations of ray tracing algorithms. It helps in understanding and debugging the path of rays in rendering simulations, which is relevant for computational physics and graphics research.

tools.name: Datoviz
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance GPU rendering library for scientific data visualization
tools.detailed_description: Datoviz is a high-performance library for scientific data visualization that leverages the Vulkan graphics API for GPU-accelerated rendering. It is designed to handle large datasets efficiently, providing fast and interactive visualizations for scientific computing.

tools.name: dicom2stl
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to extract STL surface meshes from DICOM image series
tools.detailed_description: A Python script and tool designed to convert medical DICOM image series into STL surface meshes. It supports processing of medical imaging data for 3D printing or visualization purposes.

tools.name: bpy-visualization-utils
tools.one_line_profile: Blender utilities for scientific visualization of meshes and point clouds
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Blender (bpy) utilities designed to facilitate the creation of paper-ready visualizations for scientific data, including meshes, point clouds, and occupancy grids.

tools.name: Activiz.NET
tools.one_line_profile: .NET wrapper for the Visualization Toolkit (VTK)
tools.detailed_description: Activiz.NET is a .NET wrapper for VTK (Visualization Toolkit), enabling C# and .NET developers to utilize VTK's powerful scientific visualization and data processing capabilities within .NET applications.

tools.name: fsbrain
tools.one_line_profile: R library for visualization of structural neuroimaging data
tools.detailed_description: An R library focused on structural neuroimaging, providing high-level functions to access, read, write, and visualize surface-based brain morphometry data for individuals and groups.

tools.name: vtk-dicom
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM support library for VTK
tools.detailed_description: A set of classes for using DICOM medical imaging data within the VTK (Visualization Toolkit) environment. It provides functionality for reading, writing, and processing DICOM metadata and image data.

tools.name: nla3d
tools.one_line_profile: 2D/3D finite element programming framework
tools.detailed_description: A C++ framework for 2D and 3D finite element analysis (FEA), designed for non-linear analysis of solids and structures.

tools.name: Thalassa
tools.one_line_profile: Large scale visualizations of unstructured mesh data
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by EC-JRC for large-scale visualization of unstructured mesh data, likely used in oceanographic or environmental simulations.

tools.name: DicomToMesh
tools.one_line_profile: Command line tool to transform DICOM volumes into 3D surface meshes
tools.detailed_description: A command-line utility for converting DICOM volumetric data into 3D surface meshes (OBJ, STL, PLY). It includes mesh processing routines such as reduction, smoothing, and cleaning.

tools.name: Mayavi
tools.one_line_profile: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python
tools.detailed_description: Mayavi is a powerful and user-friendly 3D scientific data visualization tool and library for Python. It provides a magic GUI for easy interaction and a scripting interface for automation, built on top of VTK.

tools.name: Epiviz
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific information visualization tool for genetic and epigenetic data
tools.detailed_description: Epiviz is an interactive visualization tool for functional genomics data. It aids in the exploration and understanding of correlations between various genome features through a web-based interface.

tools.name: ERT
tools.one_line_profile: Ensemble based Reservoir Tool for sensitivity analysis and data assimilation
tools.detailed_description: ERT (Ensemble based Reservoir Tool) is designed for running ensembles of dynamical models, particularly reservoir models. It supports sensitivity analysis and data assimilation using Ensemble Smoother methods.

tools.name: FlowCytometryTools
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for visualization and analysis of flow cytometry data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for the analysis and visualization of high-throughput flow cytometry data, providing tools for gating, transformation, and plotting.

tools.name: F3D
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and minimalist 3D viewer for scientific meshes and data
tools.detailed_description: F3D is a fast, minimalist, cross-platform 3D viewer that supports many file formats (VTK, STL, PLY, OBJ, etc.). It is designed for quick visualization of scientific meshes and point clouds.

tools.name: iso2mesh
tools.one_line_profile: 3D surface and volumetric mesh generator for MATLAB/Octave
tools.detailed_description: Iso2Mesh is a MATLAB/Octave-based mesh generation toolbox. It can create 3D tetrahedral finite element (FE) meshes from volumetric images (MRI/CT) and surface meshes from geometric primitives.

tools.name: Feel++
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Embedded Language and Library in C++
tools.detailed_description: Feel++ is a C++ library for solving partial differential equations (PDEs) using the finite element method (FEM). It provides a domain-specific language (DSL) embedded in C++ to mathematically describe and solve complex physics problems.

tools.name: BlenderPipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific data visualization pipeline for Blender
tools.detailed_description: A collection of scripts and examples designed to facilitate the import and visualization of scientific data within the Blender 3D creation suite, enabling high-quality rendering of research results.

tools.name: Flow
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Reinforcement Learning framework for traffic control
tools.detailed_description: A computational framework for applying reinforcement learning to traffic control scenarios, enabling the simulation and optimization of traffic dynamics using microscopic simulators like SUMO.

tools.name: napari-feature-visualization
tools.one_line_profile: Napari plugin for visualizing feature measurements on label images
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the napari image viewer that allows users to visualize quantitative feature measurements directly on label images, facilitating bioimage analysis and quality control.

tools.name: flowiz
tools.one_line_profile: Optical flow visualization utility
tools.detailed_description: A utility to convert optical flow files (.flo) into visualizable images or videos, supporting standard formats used in computer vision and fluid dynamics research.

tools.name: signatureSearch
tools.one_line_profile: Gene expression signature search and functional enrichment analysis
tools.detailed_description: An R/Bioconductor package for Gene Expression Signature Search (GESS) and Function Enrichment Analysis (FEA), supporting drug-target network construction and visualization for drug discovery.

tools.name: glumpy
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and scalable scientific visualization library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for scientific visualization that leverages the GPU via OpenGL to provide fast, scalable, and high-quality rendering of large datasets.

tools.name: mdciao
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and visualization of molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for the analysis and visualization of molecular dynamics (MD) simulation data, focusing on residue-residue interactions and other molecular properties.

tools.name: grit
tools.one_line_profile: Preclinical drug discovery data management platform
tools.detailed_description: A scientific research data management platform designed for storing, managing, and visualizing data from preclinical drug discovery phases.

tools.name: UnityDICOMVolumeRendering
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM volume rendering implementation for Unity
tools.detailed_description: A project enabling the volume rendering of DICOM medical imaging data within the Unity engine, suitable for medical visualization and simulation applications.

tools.name: UnityVolumeRendering
tools.one_line_profile: Volume rendering technique for Unity
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of volume rendering techniques for Unity, allowing for the visualization of 3D volumetric data, commonly used in scientific and medical fields.

tools.name: SciDAVis
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific Data Analysis and Visualization
tools.detailed_description: A user-friendly data analysis and visualization program aimed at high-quality plotting of scientific data, similar to Origin or SigmaPlot.

tools.name: simpy_visualisation
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization for SimPy discrete event simulations
tools.detailed_description: A library for visualizing discrete event simulations created with SimPy, specifically tailored for healthcare modeling and operations research.

tools.name: volsample
tools.one_line_profile: Structured Volume Sampling algorithm for rendering
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of a sample placement algorithm for real-time volume rendering that reduces aliasing, useful for high-quality scientific visualization.

tools.name: scholarium
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific paper network visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool to visualize and explore scientific papers as a network, aiding in literature review and bibliometric analysis.

tools.name: EMC-ParaView
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugins for Earth Model Collaboration data
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python programmable filters and sources for ParaView to display EMC netCDF/GeoCSV models and other auxiliary Earth science data.

tools.name: sage
tools.one_line_profile: Sim-to-real gap measurement framework for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A framework for measuring sim-to-real gaps in robot joint motions, supporting physics simulation, real hardware data collection, and statistical analysis.

tools.name: poseviz
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Human Pose Visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for visualizing 3D human poses, useful in biomechanics, computer vision, and motion analysis research.

tools.name: IMAS-ParaView
tools.one_line_profile: ParaView plugins for IMAS fusion data
tools.detailed_description: Plugins for ParaView designed to visualize General Grid Descriptions (GGDs) and other data formats from the Integrated Modelling & Analysis Suite (IMAS) for nuclear fusion research.

tools.name: SciBlend-Core
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge tool for importing Paraview scientific visualizations into Blender
tools.detailed_description: A scientific solution for Blender that facilitates the import of animation and scene setups from Paraview, enabling high-quality rendering of scientific data.

tools.name: VolumeRenderer
tools.one_line_profile: Desktop application for medical volume rendering based on VTK and Qt
tools.detailed_description: A volume rendering program designed for medical image visualization, built upon VTK, CTK, and Qt frameworks.

tools.name: ipygany
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive 3-D scientific visualization library for Jupyter Notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that enables interactive 3-D scientific visualization directly within Jupyter Notebooks, supporting various mesh and field data formats.

tools.name: DiffGeoOps
tools.one_line_profile: Library for discrete differential geometry operators on triangulated manifolds
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of discrete differential-geometry operators for triangulated 2-manifolds, useful for geometric analysis and processing in simulations.

tools.name: WebGLVolumeRendering
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight WebGL volume rendering library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for implementing volume rendering in WebGL, facilitating the visualization of 3D scalar fields in web environments.

tools.name: F3DAM
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Data-Driven Design and Analysis of Materials
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for the data-driven design and analysis of materials, supporting modeling and simulation tasks in materials science.

tools.name: vedo
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for scientific analysis and visualization of 3D data
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight and powerful Python module for scientific analysis and visualization of 3D objects and point clouds, based on VTK and NumPy.

tools.name: PyGeM
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for geometrical morphing and deformation
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for geometrical morphing techniques (such as Free Form Deformation, RBF, etc.), useful for design optimization and simulation preprocessing.

tools.name: unity-volume-rendering
tools.one_line_profile: Volume rendering implementation for Unity engine
tools.detailed_description: A volume rendering tool using object-space raymarching for Unity, enabling the visualization of volumetric data (e.g., medical scans) within the Unity environment.

tools.name: spimagine
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated volume rendering and processing for biological images
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for GPU-accelerated volume rendering and processing, specifically designed for visualizing 3D/4D biological image data.

tools.name: MeshCat Python
tools.one_line_profile: WebGL-based 3D visualization library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides a WebGL-based 3D visualizer, widely used in robotics and physics simulations for visualizing geometries, transformations, and mechanism trajectories.

tools.name: MeteoInfo
tools.one_line_profile: GIS and scientific computation/visualization environment for meteorology
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for meteorological data visualization and analysis, integrating GIS capabilities and scientific computation tools for handling atmospheric data formats.

tools.name: CryoJAX
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Cryo-EM image simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A JAX-based library for simulating cryo-electron microscopy (Cryo-EM) images, enabling differentiable physics simulations for data analysis and reconstruction algorithms.

tools.name: Project Malmo
tools.one_line_profile: AI experimentation platform built on Minecraft
tools.detailed_description: A platform for Artificial Intelligence research that uses Minecraft as a testing environment for reinforcement learning and complex agent interactions.

tools.name: pv_atmos
tools.one_line_profile: Atmospheric data visualization with ParaView
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for processing and visualizing atmospheric netCDF data using the ParaView scientific visualization software.

tools.name: IsoSurfaceExtraction
tools.one_line_profile: Isosurface extraction from voxel grids
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation for extracting isosurfaces from regular voxel grids, a fundamental algorithm in scientific visualization and geometry processing.

tools.name: FeView
tools.one_line_profile: FEM visualization tool for OpenSees
tools.detailed_description: A visualization and post-processing tool specifically designed for Finite Element Models (FEM) generated by the OpenSees simulation framework.

tools.name: apyce-project
tools.one_line_profile: Reservoir grid visualization wrapper
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based wrapper for 3D visualization of reservoir simulation grids, supporting industry-standard formats like Eclipse and Builder.

tools.name: ggsci
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific journal color palettes for ggplot2
tools.detailed_description: A collection of high-quality color palettes inspired by scientific journals and sci-fi movies, designed for creating publication-ready scientific visualizations in R.

tools.name: Koviz
tools.one_line_profile: NASA Trick simulation data visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by NASA for plotting, visualizing, and analyzing data generated by the Trick simulation environment.

tools.name: NEAT
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation sequencing read simulator
tools.detailed_description: A tool that simulates next-generation sequencing (NGS) reads, capable of learning simulation parameters (error rates, coverage) from real datasets.

tools.name: Surf-ice
tools.one_line_profile: GLSL surface rendering for neuroimaging
tools.detailed_description: A standalone visualization tool for surface rendering of neuroimaging data, supporting a wide range of mesh and tractography formats (NIfTI, GIfTI, OBJ, etc.).

tools.name: gwpv
tools.one_line_profile: Gravitational wave visualization with ParaView
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for visualizing gravitational wave simulation data using ParaView, developed for astrophysical research.

tools.name: Nion Swift
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific image processing and microscope control software
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform for controlling electron microscopes and performing data acquisition, visualization, and analysis of scientific images.

tools.name: exerpy
tools.one_line_profile: Exergy analysis tool for energy systems
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for performing exergy analysis on energy conversion systems using tabular input data from simulation software, part of the Open Energy Modelling Framework (oemof) ecosystem.

tools.name: Cassiopee
tools.one_line_profile: CFD pre- and post-processing Python/C modules for mesh manipulation and CGNS trees
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) pre- and post-processing. It provides tools for mesh generation, manipulation, and processing of CGNS (CFD General Notation System) trees, facilitating the workflow for numerical simulations.

tools.name: Inkscape Python Figures
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for creating scientific paper figures using Inkscape, Python, and Matplotlib
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool designed to streamline the creation of publication-quality scientific figures. It integrates Python plotting libraries like Matplotlib and PyVista with Inkscape for vector graphics editing, ensuring reproducible and high-quality visual outputs for research papers.

tools.name: 4DViewerBlender
tools.one_line_profile: Blender addon for visualizing 4D mesh sequences from simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool that leverages Blender's rendering capabilities to visualize time-varying 3D mesh sequences (4D data). It is particularly useful for rendering high-quality animations of simulation results or dynamic topological changes.

tools.name: PyEVTK
tools.one_line_profile: Library to export data to binary VTK files for visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the export of numerical data into binary VTK (Visualization Toolkit) file formats. This enables researchers to visualize their data using standard tools like ParaView, VisIt, or Mayavi.

tools.name: gcode2vtk
tools.one_line_profile: Converter from 3D printer G-code to VTK format for visualization
tools.detailed_description: A utility to convert G-code files (used in 3D printing/AM) into VTK format. This allows for the 3D visualization and analysis of toolpaths using scientific visualization software like ParaView, aiding in manufacturing simulation and verification.

tools.name: AVR
tools.one_line_profile: Acoustic Volume Rendering for Neural Impulse Response Fields
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of Acoustic Volume Rendering (AVR), a method for rendering neural impulse response fields. It is used for visualizing and simulating acoustic propagation in 3D environments using neural rendering techniques.

tools.name: AcoustiX
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation and dataset framework for acoustic volume rendering
tools.detailed_description: The companion repository for Acoustic Volume Rendering, providing the simulation framework or data handling capabilities required for generating and processing acoustic fields for neural rendering tasks.

tools.name: RoboMeshCat
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for visualizing robots in MeshCat
tools.detailed_description: A set of Python utilities for visualizing robotic systems and their kinematics/dynamics in the web-based MeshCat visualizer. It supports scientific and engineering tasks related to robot simulation and control.

tools.name: Phitter
tools.one_line_profile: Library for fitting statistical distributions to datasets
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to accurately fit various statistical distributions to datasets. It provides tools for parameter estimation, goodness-of-fit analysis, and visualization, supporting data analysis in scientific research.

tools.name: Axle
tools.one_line_profile: Domain Specific Language for scientific cloud computing and visualization
tools.detailed_description: A Scala-based Domain Specific Language (DSL) aimed at simplifying scientific cloud computing and visualization tasks. It provides abstractions for handling scientific data structures and generating visualizations.

tools.name: dash-vtk

tools.detailed_description: A library that brings the visualization capabilities of VTK (via vtk.js) into the Dash framework. It allows developers to build interactive web applications for scientific data visualization and analysis using Python.

tools.name: Polyhedral Template Matching
tools.one_line_profile: Algorithm for structural analysis of molecular dynamics data
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Polyhedral Template Matching (PTM) algorithm, used to classify local atomic structures in molecular dynamics simulations. It helps in identifying crystal structures and defects in materials science simulations.

tools.name: DeTikZify
tools.one_line_profile: Synthesizing TikZ graphics programs for scientific figures
tools.detailed_description: A tool that synthesizes TikZ graphics programs from sketches or images. It is specifically designed to assist researchers in creating high-quality, code-based vector graphics for scientific publications.

tools.name: PRISMA2020

tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to generate flow diagrams that comply with the PRISMA 2020 statement, which is the standard for reporting systematic reviews and meta-analyses in scientific literature.

tools.name: nuscenes_viz

tools.detailed_description: A visualization utility for the NuScenes dataset (autonomous driving data including Lidar/Radar). It uses Mayavi to render 3D point clouds and annotations, aiding in the analysis of perception data.

tools.name: cmap
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific colormaps library for Python
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library providing a collection of scientific colormaps with minimal dependencies (only NumPy). It is essential for creating perceptually uniform and accurate visualizations of scientific data.

tools.name: pycroscopy
tools.one_line_profile: Scientific analysis and visualization of nanoscale materials imaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for processing, analyzing, and visualizing multidimensional imaging and spectroscopy data, particularly from microscopy (SPM, STEM). It focuses on extracting scientific insights from large and complex datasets.

tools.name: pyqtgraph
tools.one_line_profile: Fast data visualization and GUI library for scientific applications
tools.detailed_description: A pure Python graphics and GUI library built on PyQt/PySide and NumPy. It is designed for mathematics, scientific, and engineering applications, offering fast plotting for real-time data and interactive visualization.

tools.name: pyacvd

tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the ACVD (Approximated Centroidal Voronoi Diagrams) algorithm for uniform surface mesh resampling. It is used in mesh processing pipelines to improve mesh quality for simulation or visualization.

tools.name: pyvista-gui
tools.one_line_profile: Graphical User Interface built atop PyVista
tools.detailed_description: A standalone GUI application or framework component built on top of PyVista, allowing users to interactively visualize and manipulate 3D data without writing code.

tools.name: pyvista-reality
tools.one_line_profile: OpenVR and OpenXR interface for PyVista
tools.detailed_description: An extension for PyVista that enables Virtual Reality (VR) visualization of scientific data using OpenVR and OpenXR standards. It allows researchers to explore 3D datasets in an immersive environment.

tools.name: pyvistaqt
tools.one_line_profile: Qt support widget for PyVista
tools.detailed_description: A helper library that provides a Qt widget for rendering PyVista plots. It enables the integration of high-performance 3D scientific visualization into Qt-based desktop applications.

tools.name: QuickVtk
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive VTK prototyping application based on QtQuick/QML
tools.detailed_description: A specialized viewer and prototyping tool for the Visualization Toolkit (VTK), allowing users to create and visualize VTK pipelines interactively using QML.

tools.name: qMRLab

tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox for quantitative Magnetic Resonance Imaging (qMRI) that provides tools for data simulation, fitting/analysis, and visualization of MRI data.

tools.detailed_description: A lightweight C library for extracting isosurfaces from volumetric data using the Surface Nets algorithm, generating smooth meshes for scientific visualization.

tools.name: OpenFrames

tools.detailed_description: An API for creating interactive 3D visualizations, particularly suited for astrodynamics, space trajectory analysis, and coordinate frame visualizations.

tools.name: MeshCat.jl

tools.detailed_description: A 3D visualization tool for the Julia programming language, widely used in robotics and physics simulations to render geometries and animations in a web browser.

tools.detailed_description: A software application for reading medical image formats (DICOM), performing 3D reconstruction (volume/surface rendering), and annotating images.

tools.name: ParaView_Reader_for_LIGGGHTS

tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the ParaView scientific visualization platform that enables reading and visualizing dump files from LIGGGHTS Discrete Element Method (DEM) simulations.

tools.detailed_description: A tool for performing and analyzing molecular dynamics simulations on simple model systems, focusing on sampling techniques and free energy calculations.

tools.name: ROOT

tools.detailed_description: A modular scientific software framework providing all the functionalities needed to deal with big data processing, statistical analysis, visualization, and storage, primarily used in High Energy Physics.

tools.name: MRIcroGL

tools.detailed_description: A cross-platform tool for viewing 3D medical images using hardware-accelerated volume rendering. Supports various formats like NIfTI and DICOM.

tools.detailed_description: An EEGLAB-compatible toolbox for analyzing and visualizing multivariate causality and information flow between sources of electrophysiological (EEG/MEG) activity.

tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for the ImageJ/Fiji ecosystem, supporting N-dimensional image and mesh data visualization, including VR capabilities.

tools.name: tapestry

tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to serve scientific visualizations as a microservice, enabling remote or web-based access to visualization pipelines.

tools.detailed_description: A tool for processing and visualizing Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulation data using Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR) technologies.

tools.detailed_description: A Python library for scalable downsampling, meshing, skeletonizing, and contrast normalization of large-scale neuroimaging datasets, compatible with Neuroglancer.

tools.name: Starviewer

tools.detailed_description: A simple Python-based mesh viewer utilizing PyQt5 and PyOpenGL, designed specifically for visualizing 3D meshes in graphics and geometry processing research projects.

tools.detailed_description: A plugin for RViz (Robot Visualization tool) that enables the display of meshes with per-vertex colorization, useful for visualizing scientific or sensor data mapped onto robot environments.

tools.name: khroma

tools.detailed_description: An R package providing a collection of color schemes specifically designed for scientific data visualization, ensuring perceptual uniformity and color-blindness accessibility.

tools.name: scico

tools.name: pept
