tools.detailed_description: A plugin that provides LAMMPS pair styles for deploying NequIP and Allegro deep learning interatomic potentials in large-scale molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: Aither
tools.one_line_profile: 3D block-structured Navier-Stokes solver
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solver for the Navier-Stokes equations, featuring block-structured grids and explicit/implicit time integration schemes.

tools.name: Morpheus
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic matrix type and algorithms for sparse matrices
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing dynamic matrix types and algorithms for sparse matrix computations, designed to facilitate high-performance scientific computing.

tools.name: YAKL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ framework for performance portability (Kokkos Layer)
tools.detailed_description: A simple C++ framework acting as a layer over Kokkos to provide performance portability for scientific codes, particularly for porting Fortran models to C++ and GPUs.

tools.name: DDalphaAMG
tools.one_line_profile: Multigrid solver for Lattice QCD Wilson Clover fermions
tools.detailed_description: A specialized adaptive algebraic multigrid solver library designed for inverting the Wilson Clover fermion matrix in Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (Lattice QCD) simulations.

tools.name: PETSc-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel multi-physics finite element program based on PETSc
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose, parallel finite element program developed for solving multi-physics problems, leveraging the PETSc library for scalable numerical linear algebra.

tools.name: Hybrid-Fortran
tools.one_line_profile: Unified performance portability for Fortran with CUDA/OpenACC/OpenMP
tools.detailed_description: A framework/utility to accelerate Fortran scientific codes using CUDA, OpenACC, and OpenMP in a unified and performance-portable manner.

tools.name: multiphenicsx
tools.one_line_profile: Prototyping tool for multiphysics problems in FEniCSx
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that facilitates the easy prototyping and implementation of multiphysics problems within the FEniCSx finite element framework.

tools.name: HybridQ
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid quantum circuit simulation platform
tools.detailed_description: A highly extensible platform for simulating large-scale quantum circuits on various hardware architectures, supporting both noiseless and noisy simulations with HPC integration.

tools.name: swSim
tools.one_line_profile: Solid Wave Simulation for ultrasonic NDE
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated finite difference solver for heterogeneous, anisotropic elastodynamic equations, specifically designed for ultrasonic Nondestructive Evaluation (NDE) simulations.

tools.name: Baram
tools.one_line_profile: User-friendly GUI and platform for OpenFOAM CFD simulations
tools.detailed_description: Baram is an open-source graphical user interface and platform designed to make Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) accessible. It wraps OpenFOAM solvers, providing a streamlined workflow for setting up, running, and analyzing simulations without deep command-line expertise.

tools.name: volume_distribution
tools.one_line_profile: Library for distributing 3D vectors inside a mesh volume
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for generating point distributions within the volume of a 3D mesh. This is useful for particle initialization in simulations, procedural generation, and geometry processing tasks where volumetric sampling is required.

tools.name: Phase
tools.one_line_profile: Unstructured 2D multiphase solver with immersed boundary methods
tools.detailed_description: Phase is a C++ solver for simulating multiphase flows on unstructured grids. It employs immersed boundary methods to handle complex geometries and fluid-structure interactions, suitable for research in fluid dynamics.

tools.name: petsc-hs
tools.one_line_profile: Haskell bindings for PETSc and SLEPc scientific computing libraries
tools.detailed_description: Provides Haskell bindings to the PETSc (Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation) and SLEPc libraries, enabling high-performance scientific computing and linear algebra operations within the Haskell programming environment.

tools.name: sparse-linear-algebra
tools.one_line_profile: Native Haskell library for sparse linear algebra computations
tools.detailed_description: A pure Haskell library for numerical computation focusing on sparse linear algebra. It provides data structures and algorithms for handling sparse matrices, suitable for scientific applications requiring linear solvers in Haskell.

tools.name: Maia
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed algorithms and manipulations for CGNS meshes
tools.detailed_description: Maia is a Python library developed by ONERA for handling CGNS (CFD General Notation System) meshes in a massively parallel distributed environment. It provides tools for mesh partitioning, reordering, and data exchange in HPC workflows.

tools.name: Paradigm
tools.one_line_profile: Library for managing meshes in massively parallel environments
tools.detailed_description: Paradigm is a C library from ONERA designed to manage mesh data structures in distributed memory environments. It facilitates the development of parallel solvers by handling mesh connectivity and data distribution.

tools.name: cuda-multigrid
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated multigrid solver for Poisson's equation
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-based implementation of a geometric multigrid solver for the 2D Poisson equation. It leverages GPU acceleration to provide high-performance solutions for elliptic PDEs.

tools.name: PyPartMC
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface to the PartMC particle-resolved Monte Carlo model
tools.detailed_description: PyPartMC provides Python bindings for PartMC, a particle-resolved Monte Carlo model for simulating atmospheric aerosol dynamics. It enables researchers to perform complex atmospheric simulations and analysis using Python ecosystems.

tools.name: Owl ODE
tools.one_line_profile: Differential equation solvers for the Owl scientific computing library
tools.detailed_description: Owl ODE is a library providing a collection of Ordinary Differential Equation (ODE) solvers for the Owl scientific computing ecosystem in OCaml. It supports various integration schemes for simulating dynamic systems.

tools.name: AthenaPK
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable astrophysical fluid dynamics code
tools.detailed_description: AthenaPK is a performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code. It is built on the Parthenon AMR framework and Kokkos, allowing it to run efficiently on diverse HPC architectures including GPUs.

tools.name: Parthenon
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) framework
tools.detailed_description: Parthenon is a high-performance, portable Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) framework derived from Athena++. It serves as an infrastructure for building grid-based simulation codes that can run on CPUs and GPUs using Kokkos.

tools.name: DOT
tools.one_line_profile: Decomposed Optimization Time Integration for deformation dynamics
tools.detailed_description: DOT (Decomposed Optimization Time Integration) is a simulation method and library for fast, reliable simulation of deformation dynamics. It uses domain-decomposed optimization to enable efficient convergence for frame-rate time-steps in graphics and mechanics simulations.

tools.name: PERMON
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel solvers for quadratic programming and SVMs based on PETSc
tools.detailed_description: PERMON is a library for solving quadratic programming (QP) problems and support vector machines (SVMs), built on top of PETSc. It is designed for massive parallelism and includes solvers for contact problems in mechanics.

tools.name: GeoSlicer
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for digital rocks physics and micro-CT image analysis
tools.detailed_description: GeoSlicer is an open-source platform for digital rock physics, enabling analysis of micro-CT, CT, and borehole images. It includes tools for segmentation, porosity/permeability analysis, and flow simulation in porous media.

tools.name: PETSc
tools.one_line_profile: Portable, Extensible Toolkit for Scientific Computation
tools.detailed_description: PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable (parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial differential equations. It is a foundational library for HPC, providing linear and nonlinear solvers.

tools.name: Phoebe
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for phonon and electron Boltzmann transport equations
tools.detailed_description: Phoebe is a high-performance C++ code for solving the Boltzmann transport equation for phonons and electrons. It is used to calculate transport properties like thermal conductivity and electron mobility in materials.

tools.name: PISM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Ice Sheet Model
tools.detailed_description: PISM is an open-source, parallel, high-resolution ice sheet model. It is used to simulate the dynamics of ice sheets and glaciers for climate research and sea-level rise projections.

tools.name: euler2d_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-based 2D Euler equation solver
tools.detailed_description: A finite volume solver for the 2D Euler equations implemented using the Kokkos performance portability library. It serves as a reference implementation and benchmark for developing portable HPC fluid dynamics codes.

tools.name: euler_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible hydro and MHD solver using MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A compressible hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing 2nd order Godunov schemes. It utilizes MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution across CPUs and GPUs, serving as a robust research code for HPC methods.

tools.name: ppkMHD
tools.one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos spectral difference method implementation
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of high-order spectral difference methods (SDM) for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD), accelerated with MPI and Kokkos. It targets high-performance simulation on modern hardware architectures.

tools.name: ramsesGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized astrophysics MHD simulation code
tools.detailed_description: An astrophysics Magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) simulation code optimized for large GPU clusters. It is designed to perform high-resolution simulations of astrophysical phenomena using massive parallelism.

tools.name: s-blas
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra kernels for multi-GPU scale-up platforms
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing sparse linear algebra kernels (SpMV, SpTRSV, SpTrans, SpMM) optimized for single-node multi-GPU platforms like NVIDIA DGX, developed by PNNL.

tools.name: polysolve
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper library for various linear and non-linear solvers
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library that provides a unified interface to various linear and non-linear solvers, designed to be easy to use within finite element applications like PolyFEM.

tools.name: fenicsx-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Adapter to couple FEniCSx solvers with preCICE
tools.detailed_description: An adapter enabling the integration of FEniCSx-based solvers into partitioned multi-physics simulations managed by the preCICE coupling library.

tools.name: PyAMG
tools.one_line_profile: Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers in Python
tools.detailed_description: A library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers for solving large sparse linear systems, commonly arising in solving partial differential equations.

tools.name: sunode
tools.one_line_profile: Fast ODE solver with PyMC support
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for solving Ordinary Differential Equations (ODEs) efficiently, with specific support for derivatives required by probabilistic programming in PyMC.

tools.name: python-graphblas
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for GraphBLAS sparse linear algebra
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the GraphBLAS standard, providing high-performance sparse linear algebra primitives often used in graph analytics and scientific computing.

tools.name: trng4
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel pseudo-random number generator library for Monte Carlo
tools.detailed_description: A state-of-the-art C++ library for generating pseudo-random numbers, specifically designed for sequential and parallel Monte Carlo simulations.

tools.name: raptor
tools.one_line_profile: High performance algebraic multigrid solver
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose, high-performance Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solver library written in C++.

tools.name: P3DFFT++
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel 3D Fast Fourier Transform library for multiscale simulations
tools.detailed_description: P3DFFT++ is a high-performance library for computing parallel Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT) in three dimensions. It is designed for simulating multiscale phenomena and supports 1D, 2D, and 3D domain decomposition using MPI. It serves as a core component for spectral methods in CFD and materials science.

tools.name: PSBLAS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms library
tools.detailed_description: PSBLAS (Parallel Sparse Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) is a library that implements sparse linear algebra operations on distributed memory parallel computers. It provides a framework for iterative solvers and preconditioners, essential for large-scale scientific simulations.

tools.name: SimGrid
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for simulation of distributed computer systems (Cloud, HPC, Grid)
tools.detailed_description: SimGrid is a scientific instrument for studying the behavior of large-scale distributed systems such as Grids, Clouds, HPC clusters, and Fog Computing. It allows researchers to simulate algorithms and applications to evaluate performance and correctness.

tools.name: cudaParticlesFoam
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated particle tracking extension for OpenFOAM
tools.detailed_description: cudaParticlesFoam is a library that provides GPU acceleration for Lagrangian particle tracking within the OpenFOAM CFD toolbox. It offloads particle calculations to CUDA-enabled GPUs, significantly speeding up multiphase flow simulations.

tools.name: sprs
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse linear algebra library for Rust
tools.detailed_description: sprs is a library for sparse matrix computations in Rust. It provides data structures and algorithms for sparse linear algebra, which are fundamental for implementing scientific solvers and simulations in the Rust ecosystem.

tools.name: SPARTA
tools.one_line_profile: Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) code for rarefied gas dynamics
tools.detailed_description: SPARTA is a parallel DSMC code for simulating low-density gases. It is designed to run efficiently on large-scale parallel computers and is used for modeling rarefied gas flows, such as spacecraft re-entry or vacuum systems.

tools.name: SPECTER
tools.one_line_profile: High-order PDE solver using Fourier Continuation methods
tools.detailed_description: SPECTER is a PDE solver focused on Navier-Stokes and related equations. It employs Fourier Continuation (FC-Gram) expansions to handle arbitrary boundary conditions with high accuracy and is parallelized using MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA.

tools.name: SPH-EXA
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel SPH (Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: SPH-EXA is a C++20 simulation framework for performing hydrodynamics simulations using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method. It is optimized for modern HPC architectures, supporting MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP for massive parallelism.

tools.name: SST Elements
tools.one_line_profile: Component library for the Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST)
tools.detailed_description: SST Elements provides a collection of simulation components (processors, memory, network) for the Structural Simulation Toolkit. It is used to simulate and evaluate the performance of future high-performance computing architectures.

tools.name: Stan Math Library
tools.one_line_profile: C++ template library for automatic differentiation and probabilistic modeling
tools.detailed_description: The Stan Math Library provides robust, high-performance automatic differentiation (forward, reverse, and mixed modes) and a comprehensive set of mathematical functions. It is the computational engine behind the Stan probabilistic programming language, widely used for Bayesian inference and statistical modeling.

tools.name: Sundial
tools.one_line_profile: Foundation model for time series analysis
tools.detailed_description: Sundial is a family of highly capable foundation models designed for time series analysis. It provides pre-trained models for tasks such as forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection across various scientific and industrial domains.

tools.name: ForTrilinos
tools.one_line_profile: Object-oriented Fortran interfaces to Trilinos C++ packages
tools.detailed_description: Provides portable, object-oriented Fortran interfaces to the Trilinos C++ scientific software libraries, enabling Fortran-based HPC applications to leverage Trilinos solvers.

tools.name: Trilinos
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of open-source software libraries for scientific applications
tools.detailed_description: A massive collection of reusable scientific software libraries, known as packages, designed for the solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and scientific problems.

tools.name: trotter-suzuki-mpi
tools.one_line_profile: Massively Parallel Trotter-Suzuki Solver for quantum simulations
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel implementation of the Trotter-Suzuki decomposition method for solving quantum spin systems and other matrix exponentiation problems.

tools.name: JAXFLUIDS
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Fluid Dynamics Package using JAX
tools.detailed_description: A fully differentiable computational fluid dynamics (CFD) solver written in Python using JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization and machine learning integration for fluid problems.

tools.name: quagmire
tools.one_line_profile: Surface process framework on unstructured meshes
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for modeling surface processes (erosion, transport) on highly scalable unstructured meshes, part of the Underworld geodynamics ecosystem.

tools.name: underworld2
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel PIC-FEM code for Geodynamics
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, particle-in-cell, finite element code designed for large-scale geodynamics simulations, allowing for the modeling of complex fluid flows in the Earth's mantle and lithosphere.

tools.name: vistle
tools.one_line_profile: High-Performance Simulation and Parallel Visualization Environment
tools.detailed_description: A software environment designed for high-performance simulation and parallel visualization, supporting distributed data processing and rendering on HPC clusters.

tools.name: waiwera
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel geothermal flow simulator
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, open-source simulator for geothermal flow, heat transport, and solute transport in porous media, designed for geothermal reservoir modeling.

tools.name: WfCommons
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Enabling Scientific Workflow Research
tools.detailed_description: A framework for generating synthetic scientific workflow traces and instances to support research and development of scientific workflow management systems.

tools.name: TopADD_2D_3D_Arbitrary_TopOpt_in_PETSc
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel topology optimization framework for arbitrary domains
tools.detailed_description: A 2D/3D integrated topology optimization parallel-computing framework capable of handling arbitrary design domains using PETSc.

tools.name: wrench
tools.one_line_profile: Cyberinfrastructure Simulation Workbench
tools.detailed_description: A simulation framework for building simulators of distributed computing platforms (clouds, grids, clusters) to study scientific workflow execution and resource management.

tools.name: navier_stokes_multigrid
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Navier-Stokes solver using pressure-correction and parallel multigrid
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of a 3D Navier-Stokes equation solver utilizing a pressure-correction scheme and parallel multigrid v-cycle for efficient fluid dynamics simulation.

tools.name: libyt
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for in-situ analysis and visualization connecting simulations with yt
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables in-situ analysis and visualization for simulations written in C/C++ by bridging them with the Python-based 'yt' analysis toolkit, allowing researchers to analyze data during simulation runtime.

tools.name: turbulent-cfd
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated turbulent CFD solver using CUDA and Vulkan
tools.detailed_description: A Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver capable of handling turbulence, optimized for performance on CPUs and GPUs using CUDA and Vulkan APIs.

tools.name: pystella
tools.one_line_profile: Code generator for grid-based PDE solving on CPUs and GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based code generator designed to automate the creation of high-performance code for solving grid-based Partial Differential Equations (PDEs) on both CPU and GPU architectures.

tools.name: zpc
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel computing library designed for physics-based simulations
tools.detailed_description: The Zenus Parallel Computing (ZPC) library provides infrastructure for developing high-performance, physics-based simulations, focusing on parallel execution capabilities.

tools.name: fdtd3d
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance FDTD electromagnetics solver with MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA support
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) solver for electromagnetics, supporting 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations with parallel acceleration via MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA across multiple architectures.
